channel.title: How to delete config file without any errors
channel.description: Hi there.I have a big problem.I've bought VPS.... When turning on private server I'm getting this message: Server is online...Cfg file not found.. all cfg files were in folder named "CONFIGURES"...Then I've tryed other source without "Configures" folder...all cfg files were in the same folder with "RUN SERVER" AND OTHERS... so i would like to know how to do that the all cfg files be found(on linux) or how to delete configures folder and how transfer cfg files from it...Thanks for Yours time :)

item.source: How to delete config file without any errors

item.title: How to delete config file without any errors
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Linux uses a different kind of path separator, so you need to change the paths in the server.

Here is a quick example I got from a Google search:


public class FileSeparatorExample {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        //
        // file.separator syste property return the correct file separator for
        // each different platform (Windows = \), (Linux = /)
        //
        String dataFolder = System.getProperty("user.dir") +
                System.getProperty("file.separator") + "data";
        
        System.out.println("Data Folder = " + dataFolder);
    }
}

So basically you need to replace the \ characters in the file paths with the String from System.getProperty("file.separator")

Read full topic

item.description:
@Zanzibar wrote:

This is English, you probably haven’t understood a single thing because you haven’t carefully read what he said, which you should always have done. Basically he is saying that the server he is currently using cannot find the path of the cfg files, but when using another source it works.
